summary: This bill, the Reporting Efficiently to Proper Officials in Response to Terrorism Act of 2025 (REPORT Act), mandates joint reports from relevant federal agencies (Homeland Security, Attorney General, FBI, and National Counterterrorism Center) to Congress regarding acts of terrorism in the U.S. These reports, submitted within a year of investigation completion, must be unclassified (with a classified annex option), publicly accessible, and available to any member of Congress upon request. They should include facts, security gaps, and recommendations. Agencies can withhold sensitive information that could jeopardize investigations. The Act sunsets after five years.
